rule_name: Avoid string interpolations to prevent SQL injections (MyBatis/iBatis)

CDS view association name should be defined according to the naming convention (S4/HANA)
Prefer setting cardinality for CDS view associations (S4/HANA)

When using compound indexes, avoid having different index ordering in collection access

Avoid mixing ANSI and non-ANSI JOIN syntax in the same query
Never use WHEN OTHER THEN NULL

Use ANSI standard operators in SQL WHERE clauses

Never use SQL queries with a cartesian product (SQL)
Avoid using typeid in polymorphic class from the body of its constructor or destructor.
Avoid defining, redefining or undefining standard macros from standard library
Avoid having unused labels in your program (C/C++)
Avoid using goto to jump backwards into a statement in the same function(C/C++)
Avoid #define or #undef macros anywhere other than global namespace
Avoid using # OR ## operators more than once while defining macros
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives.
Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif preprocessor directives, except as operands to the defined operator
Avoid lines starting with "#" with invalid pre-processing directive
Ensure arrays and containers are accessed using unsigned values
Bit-fields shall be either unsigned integral, or enumeration (with underlying type of unsigned integral type).
Avoid comparing types of different widths in a loop
Converting a multiplication to a larger type should be done before the multiplication takes place
Avoid checking Integer overflow without explicit cast
Avoid move constructor and move assignment operator to exit with an exception
Avoid delete operators to exit with an exception.
Avoid dynamic_cast to convert current object to its derived class from its constructor or destructor

Avoid having boolean operators with non-boolean operands (C/C++)
Avoid using 'enum' types as operands for arithmetic contexts
Member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data.
Avoid casting and converting a pointer type to an integral type (C/C++)
Avoid performing conversion from a function pointer to any other type (C/C++)
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor ordestructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases.
Avoid using C-style and functional notation casts (C++)
A base class shall be declared virtual only if it is used in a diamond hierarchy
Avoid declaring data members in non-POD classes as public or protected
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit.
Avoid using Unions
Avoid using Trigraphs
Avoid using Digraphs (C++)

Avoid doing assignments in sub-expressions (C++)

Avoid throwing exceptions outside of main()
Do not override the standard library functions (C/C++)
Avoid using Octal constants or escape sequences (C/C++)
Avoid using "sizeof" on expressions that contain side effects
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last.
